title: 9News Sydney | Thursday January 8 | Full Episode
description: In tonightâ€™s bulletin, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese makes a significant policy shift, ordering a Commonwealth Royal Commission into the Bondi tragedy and the rise of antisemitism. Former High Court judge Virginia Bell will lead the probe. Locally, a blistering three-day heatwave is just beginning to take hold across New South Wales, with temperatures in Sydneyâ€™s west already soaring to 42Â°C. In Victoria, emergency services are on high alert as out-of-control bushfires threaten regional communities under catastrophic fire danger ratings. In sport, we bid an emotional farewell to an Australian cricket legend. Usman Khawaja has played his final Test at the SCG, finishing his 14-year international career on a high with an Ashes series victory over England. title: 9News Brisbane | Thursday January 8 | Full Episode
description: Tonightâ€™s top stories include a horror multi-vehicle crash in Banya on the Sunshine Coast that has left two young toddlers and several adults fighting for their lives, and a serious weather alert for North Queensland as a tropical low edges closer to the coast with the potential to develop into a cyclone. In federal politics, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has bowed to intense pressure by announcing a Royal Commission into the Bondi tragedy and rising antisemitism. Additional coverage includes an appeal lodged by Rajwinder Singh against his murder conviction, catastrophic fire warnings in Victoria and the Gold Coast, and a shocking incident in Alexandra Hills where a car slammed into a busy Thai restaurant during the dinner rush. Finally, we look at the potential for funnel-web spider venom to save lives in heart health research and highlight new high-tech security upgrades from Toyota to combat organized car theft syndicates.
